thread.title: Celebrity Reactions to Trump's Press Conference - What Celebrities Said About Trump's Press Conference
thread.title_full: Celebrity Reactions to Trump's Press Conference - What Celebrities Said About Trump's Press Conference

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Celebrity Reactions to Trump's Press Conference - What Celebrities Said About Trump's Press Conference
text:
On Thursday, President Donald Trump held an unscheduled press conference . The purpose, it seemed, was to announce his new pick for labor secretary, Alexander Acosta , one day after Andrew Puzder withdrew his nomination for the position.
But after a minute or so of talking about Acosta, Trump launched into a nearly hour-and-a-half long rant in which he harshly criticized at the media, told a series of blatantly incorrect "facts" about how popular he was, and went off on Hillary Clinton.
 Celebrities had a lot of feelings about this one:
Kendrick Sampson The press conferences keep getting more bizarre. I honestly wonder if this man is mentally stable. And he's still going on about Hillary! pic.twitter.com/1c4CvnBnW3
‚Äî Kendrick Sampson (@kendrick38) February 16, 2017 Trump just shut down a Jewish man asking abt the rise in anti-Semitic attacks in the U.S. saying "I am the least racist/anti-Semitic person"
‚Äî Kendrick Sampson (@kendrick38) February 16, 2017 Yvette Nicole Brown Did he just ask #AprilRyan if the Congressional Black Caucus are friends of hers?
Because we ALL know each other (& look alike) amirite?
‚Äî yvette nicole brown (@YNB) February 16, 2017 Ava DuVernay He reeks of ignorance. Of disrespect. Of disdain. For anyone not like him. Props to @AprilDRyan . Keep questioning. pic.twitter.com/5Th9L0Jgms
‚Äî Ava DuVernay (@ava) February 16, 2017 Kathy Griffin If ur looking for something to do, our "precedent" is having a full meltdown on tv right now. #TrumpNewsConference
‚Äî Kathy Griffin (@kathygriffin) February 16, 2017 Rachel Maddow BREAKING: Trump drops travel ban, tells 9th Circuit: ‚Äúthe President intends in the near future to rescind the Order and replace it.‚Äù
‚Äî Rachel Maddow MSNBC (@maddow) February 16, 2017 Michelle Collins Love the BBC coming for him also how long is this fucking thing going to be I HAVE MEETINGS
‚Äî Michelle Collins (@michcoll) February 16, 2017 John Ziegler Is this a presidential address/press conference, or a self-implemented public therapy session?!
‚Äî John Ziegler (@Zigmanfreud) February 16, 2017 Does Trump realize that he is no longer running against Hillary Clinton?! I'm asking for a friend.
‚Äî John Ziegler (@Zigmanfreud) February 16, 2017 This whole thing. #trumppressconference pic.twitter.com/wUJefe5QV5
‚Äî Erin (@erninlow) February 16, 2017 Ben Walsh When you're asked about anti-Semitism, saying that the Jew who asked the question double-crossed you is not a good look.
‚Äî Ben Walsh (@BenDWalsh) February 16, 2017 Jennifer Weiner Trump: "The news is fake. The leaks are real." Sorry, but you can't have that both ways.
‚Äî Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) February 16, 2017 Steven Rich The president shushing a dude wearing a yarmulke to tell him he's the least anti-Semetic person is quite the scene. https://t.co/dmIxJOUy7N
‚Äî Steven Rich (@dataeditor) February 16, 2017 Cher @XXNazareth I Was Giving Him a Chance To Be Presidential,But All Hes Ever Going To Be, Is...The Rich Thug Sonüëäüèªüí™üèª Of a Rich Thug Fatherüëäüèªüí™üèª
‚Äî Cher (@cher) February 16, 2017 Alec Baldwin This guy is so wired in front of the press. Like he's gonna blow a rod.
Imagine what he's like behind closed doors...
‚Äî ABFoundation (@ABFalecbaldwin) February 16, 2017 Josh Gad Not watching Trump presser but if I were just going off my twitter feed, it would appear that Danny DeVito in Cuckoo's nest is our President
‚Äî Josh Gad (@joshgad) February 16, 2017 @AlecBaldwin best look for another job tonight. Trump booked the job just now. #SNL
‚Äî Josh Gad (@joshgad) February 16, 2017 Tyler Oakley at all times, it feels like we're just moments away from trump shouting, "WHY IS EVERYONE BEING SO MEAN TO ME"
‚Äî Tyler Oakley (@tyleroakley) February 16, 2017 Scott Foley This. Is. our. President. We chose him. Yes, we.
‚Äî scott foley (@scottkfoley) February 16, 2017 Michael Ian Black "Comparatively speaking, Sean Spicer is actually pretty good at his job," me watching Trump's press conference.
‚Äî Michael Ian Black (@michaelianblack) February 16, 2017 If most of your co-workers have been accused of domestic abuse, you either work at:
1. An anger management center.
2. The White House.
‚Äî Michael Ian Black (@michaelianblack) February 16, 2017 John Podhoretz No, I don't think anybody wants him to shoot the Russian ship off Connecticut. And I'm a warmonger neocon psychotic.
‚Äî John Podhoretz (@jpodhoretz) February 16, 2017 Patton Oswalt What a flailing, pathetic beta our President is. Stammers and backs down like a caught, 12 year-old shoplifter. https://t.co/AndtKy1Gfp
‚Äî Patton Oswalt (@pattonoswalt) February 16, 2017 "I am the least racist person EVER. Hey, black reporter -- what's Kanye up to? Could you text him?" #TrumpPressConference
‚Äî Patton Oswalt (@pattonoswalt) February 16, 2017 Gabrielle Union Trump LIES & when called on those LIES, gets hostile, accuses reporters of being mean, & then dismisses accountability as fake news üòê
‚Äî Gabrielle Union (@itsgabrielleu) February 16, 2017 Minnie Driver Ok, this is from the #45 press conference that JUST happened. Fake news? You know what isn't fake? The fact that he lies. pic.twitter.com/JqZ03JQdkB
‚Äî Minnie Driver (@driverminnie) February 16, 2017 Julia Ioffe Live footage of Putin watching the Trump presser. pic.twitter.com/Z08QdlnURP
‚Äî Julia Ioffe (@juliaioffe) February 16, 2017 Eliza Dushku #facepalm üòñ https://t.co/4y7qV2Wq9P
‚Äî Eliza Dushku (@elizadushku) February 16, 2017 Willie Geist President Trump didn't want that press conference to end. He's itching to get back in front of a crowd in Florida on Saturday.
‚Äî Willie Geist (@WillieGeist) February 16, 2017 Mark Cuban It's a waste of time to try to turn Pinocchio into a real President. The focus needs to be on the Geppettos and legislators around him
‚Äî Mark Cuban (@mcuban) February 16, 2017 J.K. Rowling Tearful toddlers surprised amid the shattered remains of family heirlooms have mounted more convincing defences. https://t.co/K1ZnhBM5Ja
‚Äî J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) February 16, 2017 Up until an hour ago, the scariest thing I'd ever watched was Psycho. #TrumpPresser
‚Äî J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) February 16, 2017 Follow Marie Claire on Facebook for the latest celeb news, beauty tips, fascinating reads, livestream video, and more.
From: Marie Claire
